item.title: Fly Tipping, 6th November
item.description:
I know this food street trader has a licence to trade from here, but is never open and just looks abandoned. I believe this is attracting fly tippers to the area. I have lived here for 27 years and we have never had this issue. This is on Hutchins Road in Thamesmead, the issue has been over the past three or four weeks since the food trader has not be trading and the trailer looks abandoned, making the area look unkempt there for attracting flytippers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous sight lines, 6th November
item.description:
The yellow barriers around the island at the above location is seriously restricting my view of oncoming traffic when I turn right into Abbots way. I drive a Mini which is low and I all not tall. There are points when the average vehicle, cyclists etc are 90% restricted. I would be happy to meet someone on site to discuss this. I make this turn several times a day. It does seem a very un satisfactory situation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of leaves making pavements unsafe, 6th November
item.description:
There has been a lot of leaf fall on both sides of Gunton road, making it hazardous for kids and elderly people, and people in wheelchairs and using buggies. Please could someone come and deal with the leaves asap?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old Bromley Road bicycle contraflow signage, 6th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bromley Road, Downham, London
